humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The largest tumor size in this report is 5.5 cm, which falls under the T3 category of tumors that are more than 5 cm in size. This is stated in the microscopic description section of the report: 'The previously biopsied large tumor is an infiltrating lobular carcinoma. In one 2 mm. area (block #6 within the. main tumor) , there is a focus of invasive ductal carcinoma which is. nuclear grade 1 (architectural score 1, nuclear score 2, mitotic. score 1) . In addition, in blocks 4 and 5 there is in situ tumor. which, with the help of E-Cadherin stain, proves to be ductal. carcinoma in situ, nuclear grade 2. The tumor measures 5.5 cm.' Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage of a cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the left breast tumor is measured as 5.5 cm, which falls in the T3 category. The T3 stage applies to tumors that are larger than 5 cm in size. The presence of associated infiltrating ductal carcinoma and ductal carcinoma in situ does not affect the T stage. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T3.
